question: Lucas has a vegetable stand at the community market. He sells three kinds of vegetables: roses, orchids and sunflowers. He usually sells roses for €3.53 per bunch, orchids for €5.0284615384615385 per bunch and sunflowers for €6.194 per bunch. Lucas has no change today, so he has decided to round all his prices to the nearest dollar. If Lucas sells 18 bunchs of roses, 22 bunchs of orchids and 41 bunchs of sunflowers, how much will he make?
answer:
Lucas will round his roses up from €3.53 to €4, since the number following the 3 is 5 or higher.
Lucas will round his orchids down from €5.0284615384615385 to €5, since the number following the 5 is less than 5.
Lucas will round his sunflowers down from €6.194 to €6, since the number following the 6 is less than 5.
Lucas sells 18 roses*€4 = €<<18*4=72>>72
Lucas sells 22 orchids*€5 = €<<22*5=110>>110
Lucas sells 41 sunflowers*€6 = €<<41*6=246>>246
Altogether, Lucas will make €72 + €110 + €246 = €<<72+110+246=428>>428
#### 428
